instruction: Provide personalized golf swing feedback based on quality scores and golf instruction principles.
input:
Area: setup_quality
Current Score: 0.45
Target Score: 0.75
All Quality Scores: ['0.45', '0.72', '0.68', '0.65', '0.70', '0.73', '0.69', '0.71']
Swing Type: balanced_swing
output:
WHAT SHOULD HAPPEN (Ideal/Expected):
Setup Quality (stance, posture, alignment). A sound setup creates consistency before the swing even starts. Feet should be shoulder-width apart, spine tilted slightly forward from the hips, arms hanging naturally, and alignment square to the target.

WHY IT MATTERS:
A poor setup forces compensations later in the swing. Even elite swings break down if posture or alignment is incorrect.

WHAT IS HAPPENING (Current Issue):
Your setup quality score is 45.0%, suggesting instability or misalignment at address. This is likely affecting balance and swing plane.

COMMON FAULTS:
• Rounded shoulders or excessive knee bend
• Ball too far forward or back
• Open or closed alignment

WHAT TO DO (Actionable Steps):
• Use an alignment stick along your toes
• Practice mirror setup checks before every session
• Rehearse posture without a club

FEEL / CUE:
"Athletic and tall, arms hanging freely"

PROGRESS CHECK:
Hold your setup for 5 seconds without tension or wobble before swinging.

instruction: Provide personalized golf swing feedback based on quality scores and golf instruction principles.
input:
Area: tempo_rhythm
Current Score: 0.38
Target Score: 0.68
All Quality Scores: ['0.70', '0.38', '0.65', '0.72', '0.68', '0.75', '0.69', '0.71']
Swing Type: power_swing
output:
WHAT SHOULD HAPPEN (Ideal/Expected):
Tempo & Rhythm should feel smooth and repeatable. The backswing should be controlled, with a gradual transition into the downswing.

WHY IT MATTERS:
Power comes from sequencing, not speed. Rushed tempo disrupts timing and reduces strike quality.

WHAT IS HAPPENING (Current Issue):
Your tempo score of 38.0% indicates rushing the transition or jerky acceleration.

COMMON FAULTS:
• Snatching the club away
• Over-accelerating from the top
• No pause at transition

WHAT TO DO (Actionable Steps):
• Count "1-2" back, "3" down
• Swing at 70% speed for full sessions
• Practice with metronome tempo drills

FEEL / CUE:
"Smooth back — fast through"

PROGRESS CHECK:
Ball contact improves before distance increases.

instruction: Provide personalized golf swing feedback based on quality scores and golf instruction principles.
input:
Area: weight_shift
Current Score: 0.52
Target Score: 0.82
All Quality Scores: ['0.68', '0.75', '0.52', '0.70', '0.65', '0.72', '0.69', '0.71']
Swing Type: precision_swing
output:
WHAT SHOULD HAPPEN (Ideal/Expected):
Weight should load into the trail side on the backswing, then move decisively onto the lead foot during the downswing. At impact, most weight is forward.

WHY IT MATTERS:
Proper weight shift improves compression, consistency, and directional control.

WHAT IS HAPPENING (Current Issue):
Your score of 52.0% suggests hanging back or sliding instead of rotating.

COMMON FAULTS:
• Staying on back foot at impact
• Lateral slide instead of rotation

WHAT TO DO (Actionable Steps):
• Step-through drill
• Hit half shots with feet together
• Pause at the top and shift before swinging

FEEL / CUE:
"Pressure into lead heel"

PROGRESS CHECK:
Divots start appearing in front of the ball.

instruction: Provide personalized golf swing feedback based on quality scores and golf instruction principles.
input:
Area: body_rotation
Current Score: 0.65
Target Score: 0.85
All Quality Scores: ['0.72', '0.68', '0.75', '0.65', '0.70', '0.73', '0.69', '0.71']
Swing Type: balanced_swing
output:
WHAT SHOULD HAPPEN (Ideal/Expected):
Shoulders rotate fully on the backswing while hips resist slightly. Downswing starts from the ground up.

WHY IT MATTERS:
Rotation creates speed while maintaining control. Arms alone cannot generate consistent power.

WHAT IS HAPPENING (Current Issue):
Your score of 65.0% suggests limited shoulder turn or early hip spin.

COMMON FAULTS:
• All-arms swing
• Hips firing too early

WHAT TO DO (Actionable Steps):
• Cross-arm rotation drills
• Chair or wall hip-depth drill

FEEL / CUE:
"Turn shoulders behind the ball"

PROGRESS CHECK:
More effortless distance with same swing speed.
